othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Publish workflow steps and activate the workflow so new form instances trigger the defined processes.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: publish and activate workflows for runtime

body.context: Once the workflow is created, you need to publish the workflow. Publishing a workflow makes the workflow available to the system. That is, workflow action buttons are made available in a form when a new instance of the associated form is created on the relevant list page in .

li.p: In the module menu, click Administration.
In the navigation pane, expand Configuration Toolkit folder, and then click Workflow Management.
The WORKFLOW LIST page is displayed.
To publish the workflow, perform either of the following steps:

ul.li:
From the list page:
Select the newly created workflow that must be published.
Click Publish.

From the details page of the workflow:
Select the newly created workflow that must be published, and then click Edit.
Click Publish.

p.note:
When existing workflows are modified and published, only new instances of forms are affected. All forms created with the previous workflow continue to operate with the previous definition of the workflow. All-new forms operate with the modified workflow.
You can also un-publish a workflow. This is used when a form already associated with an existing workflow has to be assigned with the newly created workflow. You can un-publish the earlier workflow by selecting the published workflow that has to be unpublished and then click Un-Publish.
